programme.title: ABC News Regional Ep48
programme.desc: Take a closer look at what's making headlines in regional and rural Australia. ABC News reporters uncover the news and unique stories about what's going on outside the big cities. Presented by Amy Culpitt. (Final for 2022)

programme.title: ABC News Ep102
programme.desc: Miriam Corowa presents the latest from ABC News, following today's top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, expert analysis and all the updated news, sport, weather and information you need.

programme.title: Women in Sport Spotlight Ep1
programme.desc: ABC News puts the spotlight on women making a big impact in the sporting world - from the grassroots through to the elite level, with a focus on women from under-represented backgrounds. Presented by Amanda Shalala.

programme.title: That Pacific Sports Show Ep29
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - Sera Naiqama and Sam Wykes talk sport with Rugby League and Union star Kennedy Cherrington. Vai Ripley brings us the story of the Gaulofa, a traditional twin hull sailing craft being used to teach cultural values in Samoa.

programme.title: Kurt Fearnley's One Plus One Ep9
programme.desc: Mat Rogers reached the pinnacle representing Australia in rugby league and union, but spent much of his life in his father Steve's shadow. Mat speaks candidly about his mental health struggles and paving his own path.

programme.title: ABC News With Auslan Ep57
programme.desc: The latest news and information from ABC News. This bulletin will be Auslan interpreted to provide accessible information to keep Australia's deaf community connected and informed. Presented by Miriam Corowa. (Final for 2022)

programme.title: The World This Week Ep48
programme.desc: Girish Sawlani looks at the week in international news including China's hospitals overwhelmed with COVID cases, calls for a recount in Fiji's election plus the alleged Lockerbie bombmaker finally in custody. (Final for 2022)

programme.title: ABC Evening News Ep102
programme.desc: Mariam Saab presents the latest from ABC News, covering today's top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, expert analysis and updated news from all corners of Australia and around the globe.

programme.title: Compass Ep22
programme.desc: Sr. 36 - When broadcaster Indira Naidoo's sister suicided, Indira sought solace in her daily walks. Through nature's cycle of renewal - and with the help of some key people, she found her own ways to keep living.

programme.title: ABC News Sunday Ep51
programme.desc: Mariam Saab presents the latest from ABC News, covering today's top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, expert analysis and updated news from all corners of Australia and around the globe.

programme.title: A Girl's Guide To Hunting, Fishing And Wild Cooking Ep6
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Analiese faces her biggest challenge yet, slaughtering the pigs she's reared for meat. Friends from the mainland, including Adam Liaw, Jo Barrett and Alanna Sapwell who reaffirm her commitment to her new life.

programme.title: Christmas In Australia With Christine Anu
programme.desc: Celebrate Christmas with Christine Anu as she explores how Australia's melting pot of traditions, cultures and faiths not only sparks festive joy, but rejoices in the kindness and resilience of Australians.

programme.title: Classic Choir: Oh Christmas Tree
programme.desc: The ABC Classic Choir sing a new arrangement of a Christmas favourite 'Oh Christmas Tree (Yerrbill with Clarence)' with new lyrics by Gardening Australia's Clarence Slockee and musical arrangement by Joseph Twist.

programme.title: Fault Lines 2022
programme.desc: We thought we'd beaten COVID, until war and economic strife, protest and authoritarianism reminded us how rapidly things can change in a connected world. War, inflation and an unfolding climate crisis sets the scene for 2023.

programme.title: Outback Vet Ep5
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - In Karratha, Dr Katy has been given custody of two endangered Hawksbill turtles, and we follow their journey back to the sea. A leg amputation doesn't slow down one very energetic puppy.

programme.title: Back To Nature Ep3
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Hosts Aaron Pedersen and Holly Ringland visit South Australia's Mount Lofty Ranges, meet a senior Kaurna man, and hear about the creation giant Nganno. Near the coast they walk with artist and chef Poh.

programme.title: Anh's Brush With Fame Ep13
programme.desc: Sr. 6 - Dr Harry Cooper is Australia's original TV vet and one of our most trusted faces. He built a successful vet practice and then stumbled onto our screens where he's remained ever since. Anh captures his wisdom and passion.

programme.title: Compass Ep22
programme.desc: Sr. 36 - When broadcaster Indira Naidoo's sister suicided, Indira sought solace in her daily walks. Through nature's cycle of renewal - and with the help of some key people, she found her own ways to keep living.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight Ep102
programme.desc: The final word on the day's top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australia's most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: Landline Ep5
programme.desc: A look back at a sample of our best Landline stories from 2022. A growing taste for Australian goat meat and the breeding program bringing Macquarie Perch back from extinction.

programme.title: ABC News Regional Ep48
programme.desc: Take a closer look at what's making headlines in regional and rural Australia. ABC News reporters uncover the news and unique stories about what's going on outside the big cities. Presented by Amy Culpitt. (Final for 2022)

programme.title: That Christmas
programme.desc: Eleven poignant, funny and powerful stories about Christmas like no other, told by the people who lived through them. Some of the storytellers are familiar faces, some are new.

programme.title: Classic Choir: Oh Christmas Tree
programme.desc: The ABC Classic Choir sing a new arrangement of a Christmas favourite 'Oh Christmas Tree (Yerrbill with Clarence)' with new lyrics by Gardening Australia's Clarence Slockee and musical arrangement by Joseph Twist.

programme.title: That Pacific Sports Show Ep29
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - Sera Naiqama and Sam Wykes talk sport with Rugby League and Union star Kennedy Cherrington. Vai Ripley brings us the story of the Gaulofa, a traditional twin hull sailing craft being used to teach cultural values in Samoa.

programme.title: The Business: Summer Series Ep1
programme.desc: How deep will the housing downturn go? We speak to property analysts, economists, and real estate agents about whether prices will rebound in 2023, plus top tips on buying or selling in this market. Presented by Alicia Barry.

programme.title: The World This Week Ep48
programme.desc: Girish Sawlani looks at the week in international news including China's hospitals overwhelmed with COVID cases, calls for a recount in Fiji's election plus the alleged Lockerbie bombmaker finally in custody. (Final for 2022)

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch Ep44
programme.desc: Lisa Millar and James Glenday hear from British DJ Fatboy Slim, Knives Out actor Daniel Craig, movie critic Zak Hepburn on the best and worst in 2022, plus Alice Zaslavsky with some festive dessert ideas. (Final for 2022)

programme.title: Kurt Fearnley's One Plus One Ep10
programme.desc: Nornie Bero has a passion for food. The Torres Strait Islander chef wants people to embrace Indigenous ingredients and seasonal, local produce. Nornie tells how her childhood on the islands has influenced her business.

programme.title: ABC News Regional Ep48
programme.desc: Take a closer look at what's making headlines in regional and rural Australia. ABC News reporters uncover the news and unique stories about what's going on outside the big cities. Presented by Amy Culpitt. (Final for 2022)

programme.title: Landline Ep5
programme.desc: A look back at a sample of our best Landline stories from 2022. A growing taste for Australian goat meat and the breeding program bringing Macquarie Perch back from extinction.

programme.title: News Breakfast: Early Ep251
programme.desc: There's always something new to talk about over breakfast. Iskhandar Razak and Madeleine Morris bring you the latest overnight developments plus news and interviews, Charles Brice with sport, and Emma Rebellato with weather.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings Ep246
programme.desc: Joe O'Brien brings you the top stories of the morning and the latest news as it happens. We cross to ABC News reporters on the scene across Australia and around the globe plus media conferences and analysis from experts.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon Ep246
programme.desc: Watch what happens as the day unfolds. Ros Childs brings you the top stories, breaking news, original reporting plus the latest details and special guests to keep you informed and up to date on the issues that matter.

programme.title: Gardening Australia: Christmas Family Special 2017

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters Ep2

programme.title: Escape From The City Ep34

programme.title: Chopsticks Or Fork? Ep2
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - In 2019, the Black Summer bushfires swept through Malua Bay and destroyed Raymond's Chinese Restaurant. Ten months later, it rose from the ashes with a sleek new look, and with Raymond's daughter Emily now at the helm.

programme.desc: A famous pottery town makes cat figurines, but there are real kitties too! Head to Nagoya to visit a coffee shop kitty, then to a mountain town to check out traditional dolls with another cat.

programme.desc: Established as a fortress city during the Spanish colonial period, Manila is the capital of the Philippines. In this episode, we explore the city, which is changing due to its developing economy.

programme.title: Nhk Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Face To Face
programme.desc: Our guest is Yoko Tawada, winner of the 2018 US National Book Award for Translated Literature. Based in Germany, she writes in Japanese and German, which she says is behind her unique take on Japan.

programme.title: No Art, No Life Plus
programme.desc: Outsider artists like Miruka are gaining recognition around the world. Although she creates mainly for herself, others have taken notice. See how these artists live and work.

programme.title: Dining With The Chef Mini
programme.desc: Learn about easy, delicious, and healthy cooking with Chef Rika in five minutes! Featured recipe: Rika's Chakin Sushi.

programme.title: A Cat'S-Eye View Of Japan
programme.desc: A famous pottery town makes cat figurines, but there are real kitties too! Head to Nagoya to visit a coffee shop kitty, then to a mountain town to check out traditional dolls with another cat.

programme.title: Nhk Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Songs Of Tokyo Festival 2022 Day1
programme.desc: Day1: ATARASHII GAKKO!, Higuchi Ai, Kageyama Hironobu, Kitadani Hiroshi, macaroni empitsu, Mizuki Nana, Naniwa Danshi.

programme.title: Nhk Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.desc: A young man makes a fresh start on a small island in central Japan with a mission to revive the local community. We follow him and the islanders as they seek a way forward together.

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: #4 I'm going to study Japanese at a university. / Talk about your plans. Put "shimasu" after the plan to explain what you are going to do.

programme.title: Core Kyoto Mini
programme.desc: Kirikane, the beauty of gossamer gold leaf craftsmanship. Dive deep into the ancient capital, still innovative 1,200 years after its foundation.

programme.title: Wild Hokkaido!
programme.desc: Our stage this time is Kiritappu in the eastern part of Hokkaido Prefecture. Our program host explores the vast wetland, and observes a variety of wildlife as well as plants during winter.

programme.title: Nhk Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Songs Of Tokyo #34 Japanese Divas
programme.desc: Featuring two divas: Hajime Chitose, a singer with deep roots of folk songs of Amami Oshima Island, and Nagaya Haruko, the vocalist of Ryokuoushoku Shakai-a band that carries on the DNA of J-POP.

programme.title: Easy Japanese For Work
programme.desc: Today: helping out a struggling coworker. Aung Zin Phyo, from Myanmar, works for a firm that makes 3D CG images. In a roleplay challenge, he must help a coworker who's struggling with their workload.

programme.title: Japan'S Top Inventions (28 Min.)
programme.desc: The fascinating stories and secrets behind hit Japanese products, plus parts and machines that boast the top share of niche markets. This time: ventilators for infants & electron beam lithography.

programme.title: 100 Ideas To Save The World

programme.title: UFC Fight Night : Cannonier vs Strickland
programme.desc: Prelims - Top 10 middleweights collide on December 18, as Jared Cannonier faces off with Sean Strickland in the five-round UFC Fight Night main event at the Amway Center in Orlando, Florida. One of the hardest punchers in the sport, pound-for-pound, Cannonier is well aware that a big win this fall will put him back in the title conversation at 185 pounds, but he will have to dig deep to get it against a fellow elite striker in Strickland, who has won six of his last seven matchups.
